about_me.headline: Who I am
about_me.title: About me
about_me.intro: Hi, I am Tobias. I come from a background in product and 3D design, where I learned how to turn complex ideas into tangible results. Now I do the same through code: building modern, responsive interfaces and thoughtful Python-based backends. When design and logic come together, that’s where I feel at home.
about_me.question1: Remote, hybrid, or onsite - what matters most to me is effective collaboration. Location is secondary.
about_me.question2: I learn quickly, experiment often, and integrate new tools or frameworks into small projects to understand how they work in practice.
about_me.question3: I enjoy collaborative work because different perspectives often lead to more elegant solutions.

skills.intro: I work across both front-end and back-end development, building responsive interfaces with HTML, CSS and JavaScript, and developing structured, reliable logic with Python. My background in product and 3D design gives me a strong sense for usability, clean structure and detail. I stay curious, learn quickly, and keep up with the fast pace of modern web development.
skills.contactMe: Feel free to reach out. I’m always open to new projects and opportunities to grow, collaborate and build on my existing experience.

contact.encourageText: Just drop me a message if you need support. I’m always excited to collaborate and create something meaningful together.

testimonials.headline: what my colleagues say about me

first.text: Tobias is a reliable and committed member of the project team. He communicates clearly and contributes to efficient coordination. His structured approach and consistent use of project management principles ensure stable workflows. His clean, readable code and technical accuracy play a key role in the project’s success.
first.author: Demis Moysidis – Join

second.text: Tobias demonstrates strong competence and works in a structured and precise way. He solves complex problems through analytical thinking and remains calm when facing challenges. His experience and teamwork make him a key contributor and a respected colleague.
second.author: Amer Alkhalidy – Join

third.text: Tobias works with great commitment and takes on a large share of the project tasks. His reliability and responsibility ensure the project’s success. Without his consistent effort, the result would not have reached the same level. I fully recommend him.
third.author: Madina Askar Zada – Kochwelt

fourth.text: Tobias shows ambition and finds solutions for every challenge. He supports team members reliably and shares his knowledge openly. His help strengthens the team’s collaboration.
fourth.author: Julian Kohn – Join

projects.headline: Portfolio
projects.description: Explore a selection of my work here - Interact with projects to see my skills in action.

join.name: Join
join.description: A Kanban-style task manager built with Angular, TypeScript and Firebase. I worked on the frontend, implemented services and forms, and managed the GitHub workflow. I also took over the Scrum-based project management, bringing structure and coordination to the team.

knighthood.name: Knighthood
knighthood.description: An object-oriented jump-and-run game featuring expanded gameplay and a fully redesigned look. I created custom sprites and sounds, added mechanics like two projectile types, a punch-and-sword combat system, multiple enemy types, a parallax background, and a scoreboard. The game logic is implemented in JavaScript, with layout handled in HTML and CSS.

dabubble.name: DA Bubble
dabubble.description: A Slack clone that enhances team communication with an intuitive interface, real-time messaging and robust channel organization.

pokedex.name: Pokedex
pokedex.description: A digital Pokédex app that dynamically loads Pokémon data such as types, abilities and evolutions using the PokéAPI. I implemented data fetching and processing in JavaScript and designed the interface with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates my ability to structure API data and translate it into a responsive, user-friendly frontend.
